body: What size files are you copying and which remote storage system. Also which OS?
Copying from a local drive mounted drive to Backblaze Storage via Linux

Currently rclone makes a temporary copy of the file it is copying before uploading to B2.  This is due to the way the b2 API works.  I'm hoping to turn that into reading the file twice, but that requires some re-architecting of rclone's internals.

There is a note about this on the b2 page: http://rclone.org/b2/

You can override which directory rclone uses to make temp file by setting the `TMPDIR` environment variable.

I'm going to turn this ticket into one to remind me to fix this properly!

rename.to: b2: don't make temporary copy of files when uploading

body: Cool will try out the TMPDIR environment variable.  Not sure why it's having issues copying though when the directory has space available.
Would be possible if #282 is implemented. I might give it a try.

issue.title: Change Put/Update interface

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Create separate interface for object information; `ObjectInfo`.

See discussion at #282.

The read-only parts of the Fs has also been separated out in to `FsInfo`, so there cannot be any unintentional changes made to the source Fs.

issue.title: Avoid b2 temporary file.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

body: The fix for this will be in the next release!
